title: Dahi Handi Festival
subtitle: Celebration of Krishna’s Mischievous Spirit
overview: Dahi Handi is a lively festival celebrated on Janmashtami, marking Lord Krishna’s birth.
Groups form human pyramids to break earthen pots filled with curd, symbolizing Krishna’s childhood pranks.

highlights.title: Joyful Celebration
highlights.description: Youthful enthusiasm, chants, and colors fill the streets.

geography.intro: Primarily celebrated in Mumbai, Thane, Pune, and Nashik.

climate.description: Monsoon time — expect rain and cheer.

geography.conclusion: Dahi Handi embodies the spirit of courage, coordination, and faith.

activities.title: Forming Human Pyramids
activities.description: Teams of Govindas compete to reach the hanging Handi.

activities.title: Street Photography
activities.description: Capture thrilling pyramid formations and joy.
info: Best spots in Thane, Ghatkopar, Dadar.

attractions.title: Gokulashtami Celebrations
attractions.description: Temples host devotional programs before Dahi Handi.

attractions.title: Thane Handi Festival
attractions.description: One of the biggest celebrations with huge crowds.

marineLife.intro: The festival is a lively urban cultural event.

items.title: Unity in Diversity
items.description: Teams from all communities join the celebration.

conclusion: The Dahi Handi festival is Maharashtra’s heart beating with devotion and energy.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Local trains connect all major festival areas.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Public transport and taxis widely available in Mumbai and Thane.

bookingTips.description: Arrive early for best photography angles.
Carry rain gear — the festival coincides with monsoon.
